messages.content: Dear Resident, As your Labour parliamentary candidate for Chipping Barnet, I want to offer a fairer future for local people in my home town.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will extend free childcare for 3-4 year olds; guarantee wraparound care from 8am-6pm for primary school age children.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Energy bills and rail fare freezes
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure energy bills can fall but not rise until 2017; cut commuter rail fares; cap annual rail fare increases.
Hire thousands more nurses, doctors and home care-workers; reduce waiting times for cancer tests and GP appointments; ensure patients are put before profit.
Get 200,000 homes a year built by 2020; invest in genuinely affordable housing; secure a fairer deal for those who rent.
Slash tuition fees; guarantee apprenticeships for school leavers who get the right grades; invest in low carbon technology to deliver high-skilled green jobs.
Deliver the stronger growth needed to balance the books and cut the deficit. None of our manifesto commitments require extra borrowing.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour can beat the Tories here. In the 2014 local elections, Labour won 11 out of the 21 council seats in the Chipping Barnet area.

issues.economy: Slash tuition fees; guarantee apprenticeships for school leavers; low carbon technology to deliver high-skilled green jobs; stronger growth needed to balance the books and cut the deficit.
issues.education: Slash tuition fees; guarantee apprenticeships for school leavers who get the right grades; invest in low carbon technology to deliver high-skilled green jobs.
issues.environment: Invest in low carbon technology to deliver high-skilled green jobs.
issues.governance: None of our manifesto commitments require extra borrowing.
issues.health: Hire thousands more nurses, doctors and home care-workers; reduce waiting times for cancer tests and GP appointments; ensure patients are put before profit.

housing.content: Get 200,000 homes a year built by 2020; invest in genuinely affordable housing; secure a fairer deal for those who rent.

leaflet.personalStatement: I grew up in Chipping Barnet and I live and work here. I am passionate about making sure local people have opportunities to succeed and good-quality public services that they can rely upon.

politicalExperience.achievements: Successfully represented local people on issues ranging from housing to parking enforcement, and have been campaigning for 30 minutes free parking in our town centres, for rental standards in the private rented housing sector and against Tory cuts that hit the poorest in our community the hardest.

contactInformation.address: Chipping Barnet Labour, 104 East Barnet Road, Barnet EN4 8RE

images.caption: Amy Trevelyan, Labour candidate for Chipping Barnet.
